title: The delivery of your scene depends on your co-star: Nawazuddin Siddiqui | bollywood | Hindustan Times
text:
The delivery of your scene depends on your co-star: Nawazuddin Siddiqui bollywood Updated: Feb 13, 2017 12:54 IST Hindustan Times Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui talks about the importance of having a good chemistry with co-stars onscreen. 
Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui’s has proved his acting prowess time and again and has been appreciated by the critics and masses alike. But, according to him, any actor’s individual performance can’t guarantee a perfect scene in any film. Read more See pics: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Chandan Sanyal in Manto 
“When a good scene is delivered , it is made because of your co-actor. You can’t deliver a scene alone. If I get any kind of appreciation, it will be because my co-stars took that responsibility of getting the right temperament with me and vice versa,” says Siddiqui. 
The actor, who was last seen in director Rahul Dholakia’s film Raees, feels that his co-star Shah Rukh Khan, helped him build a great onscreen chemistry. 
“The great thing about our shots was that Shah Rukh put in a lot of efforts and it ultimately made our scenes come out really well on the silver screen,” he says. 
Siddiqui, who has been part of films such as Gangs of Wasseypur(2012), Talaash(2012), The Lunchbox (2013) and Badlapur(2015), has often been tagged as an art house actor, but he doesn’t believe in such tags. 
“When I start working on a project, I don’t believe or classify it into commercial, independent or parallel cinema. A film can not be any of that, it can just be a good film or a bad one,” says the actor. 
Follow @htshowbiz for more
